The certified copy of the said order has been received on August 18, 2010 and the same has been filed with the Registrar of Companies, Gujarat on the same day. As a result, the said scheme of amalgamation has become effective from the appointed date (i.e. April 01, 2010 in case of all transferor companies other than Advance Tradex and April 20, 2010 in case of Advance tradex). Since the scheme of Amalgamation has become effective, M/s MPSEZ has become a subsidiary of the Company with 77.49% shareholding by the Company. Further, the Company has informed the Exchange that on August 13, 2010 the Board of Directors of the Company has approved the Unaudited Financial Results of the Company for the quarter ended on June 30, 2010. In order to reflect the present scenario - post Amalgamation and MPSEZ becoming subsidiary of the Company, the Directors of the Company, vide Circular Resolution dated August 18, 2010 approved the Adjusted Unaudited Financial Results of the Company for the quarter ended on June 30, 2010 after taking into account the effect of Amalgamation - especially the Financial Results of MPSEZ for the Quarter ended on June 30, 2010 with that of the Company. In order to provide updated information about the financials of the Company, the Company has submitted the Financial Results of the Company for the Quarter ended on June 30, 2010 after taking into account the effect of Scheme of Amalgamation.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Adani Exports Ltd has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on May 20,2006 the following items were deliberated and agreed upon subject to various formalities and approvals - 1) The Board discussed at length its overall business model comprising of the following SBUs : a) "Energy" Group, b) "Agro" Group, c) "Metals" Group, d) "Real Estate Group". It was generally agreed that the Adani Group's several initiatives for these SBUs would be structured under a appropriate division/subsidiary of Adani Exports Limited, subject to various approvals and formalities. This would present an integrated profile of each SBU in its entire value chain, under the overall structure of Adani Exports Limited. 2) The Real Estate Group has taken large initiatives in the cities of Mumbai and Ahmedabad aggregating to about 25 million square feet of development envisaging a product mix of township and integrated complexes of retail, commercial and residential units. The Real Estate initiatives under Adani Exports Limited would be through separate "special purpose vehicles" structure. Adani Exports Limited would explore joint and alliance arrangements for this business. 3) Looking at its integrated Commodity businesses, the board deliberated on change of name of Adani Exports Limited to "Adani Enterprises Limited" or such other name to reflect the business diversity, and suggested the initiation of the necessary formalities.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on May 15, 2006 that  Adani group is closing in on a mega Rs. 1,500 crore real estate deal in Bandra-Kurla complex in Mumbai. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of Adani Exports Ltd. Adani Exports Ltd has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "With reference to the news item regarding Adani Group, please note that we have decided to foray into real estate business through our subsidiary company and are in the process of finalization of various properties including the one at Bandra-Kurla Complex. A separate team has been set up to process various business related issues and Adani Group shall nurture the said business like its other ventures."
